content:
That's wonderful to hear! It's always inspiring to see industry professionals like Rachel Morrison being humble and willing to share their knowledge with others. It's a great reminder that even at the highest levels of success, it's possible to remain grounded and generous.

And how cool that you got to have a conversation with the director of "The Weight of Water"! It's always exciting to connect with filmmakers and learn more about their creative process. A Q&A session is a great way to get insight into the thought and effort that goes into making a film, and it's even more special when you can have a one-on-one conversation with the director.

"The Weight of Water" sounds like a fascinating film, and I'm curious - what was it about the narrative structure that stood out to you? Was there a particular aspect of the film's storytelling that resonated with you, or did it challenge your expectations in some way?

Also, did you find that your conversation with the director influenced your own approach to filmmaking or storytelling in any way? Sometimes, hearing from other creatives can spark new ideas or inspire us to try something different in our own work.
